snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, in his second year in office, had to accept less than he had sought on issues like pensions and redistricting.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, in his second year in office, says he has had to accept less than he wanted on issues like pensions and redistricting; concedes an improbable string of victories in his rookie year and says that although he lacks a signature achievement in his second year, he came to Albany to improve the function of his state's government and is achieving that goal.

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM, JOHN ELIGON and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, in his second year in office, had to accept less than he had sought on issues like pensions and redistricting.

headline.seo: Cuomo Admits Setbacks but Says He Asked for the Moon
headline.main: Cuomo, Admitting Setbacks, Says He Asked for the Moon
headline.print_headline: Cuomo, Admitting Setbacks, Says He Asked for the Moon
